title: Senator Approval
question_text:
Suppose $15$ randomly chosen subjects are questioned on whether they approve of their U.S. senator.
Of these, $3$ â€‹subjects approved, and $12$ did not approve of their senator. A $90\%$ confidence interval was computed on this data.
Which of the following statements is correct?

choices.text:
We are
90
%
confident that the true proportion of subjects who approve of their senator is between
3
%
and
37
%
.

This survey gives strong evidence that the true proportion of subjects who approve of their senator is less than
35
%
.

We are
90
%
confident that the true proportion of subjects who approve of their senator is between
13.3
%
and
26.6
%
.

We are
90
%
confident that the true proportion of subjects who approve of their senator is between
17

and
23
%
.
A confidence interval in this situation should NOT be done as assumptions are not met.
